description: Urticaria (hives) is a skin condition characterized by the sudden appearance of red or skin-colored wheals (welts) that are itchy, raised, and often transient. These lesions may last for minutes to hours and frequently migrate across the body. It can be acute, chronic, or triggered by physical, emotional, or allergic stimuli.
visual_features: Raised, red or pale wheals with itching
Skin returns to normal after lesions fade
May leave no marks unless scratched
miasm: Psoric predominantly; also Sycotic and Tubercular in chronic/recurrent forms
clinical_notes: Chronic urticaria may indicate a deeper miasmatic layer or systemic hypersensitivity. Suppression with antihistamines or ointments may shift the expression to deeper organs like lungs (e.g., asthma). Emotional or dietary history often reveals the root trigger. Intercurrent remedies or anti-miasmatic support may be required in relapsing cases.

description: Acne is a chronic inflammatory condition of the pilosebaceous glands, commonly affecting the face, chest, and back. It presents as comedones (blackheads and whiteheads), papules, pustules, nodules, cysts, and may lead to post-inflammatory pigmentation or scarring. Acne is most frequent during adolescence but may persist into adulthood.

clinical_notes: Acne is often linked with hormonal imbalances or lifestyle habits. Chronic or cystic acne suggests deep-seated miasmatic involvement. Suppressed acne with ointments may result in scarring or systemic disturbances. Emotional and dietary factors must be considered for accurate homeopathic remedy selection.
